problem: ESTIMATE Karate blow. Estimate the impulse and the average force delivered by a karate blow that breaks a board. Assume the hand moves at roughly 10 m/s when it hits the board.

steps.explanation: State which fundamental formulas will be used to solve the problem.
steps.notations: We will use the impulse-momentum theorem: J = Δp = m Δv, and the relation between average force and impulse: F̄ = J / Δt

steps.explanation: Define variables with estimated values from the problem. The effective striking mass (arm and fist) is estimated as 0.70 kg, initial speed is given as 10 m/s, final speed is estimated as 0 m/s (hand comes to rest), and contact time is estimated as 5 ms.
steps.notations: Given: m₍hand₎ ≈ 0.70 kg, vᵢ = 10 m/s, v₍f₎ ≈ 0 m/s, Δt ≈ 5.0 × 10⁻³ s

steps.explanation: Substitute the values into the impulse formula.
Substitute the impulse and time interval into the average force formula.
State the final results with proper interpretation.
steps.notations: Impulse magnitude ≈ 7 N·s (directed opposite to hand motion); average force on the board ≈ 1.4 kN

solution:
J = m Δv
Given: m₍hand₎ ≈ 0.70 kg, vᵢ = 10 m/s, v₍f₎ ≈ 0 m/s, Δt ≈ 5.0 × 10⁻³ s
Δv = v₍f₎ − vᵢ = 0 − 10 = −10 m/s
J = (0.70 kg)(−10 m/s) = −7.0 N·s
|J| ≈ 7.0 N·s
F̄ = J / Δt = 7.0 N·s / (5.0 × 10⁻³ s)
F̄ = 1.4 × 10³ N = 1.4 kN
Impulse ≈ 7 N·s (opposite hand motion); Average force ≈ 1.4 kN
